articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas is set to hand over three Israeli hostages on Saturday in exchange for Palestinian detainees and prisoners in the latest stage of a ceasefire deal aimed at opening the way to ending the 15-month war in Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas set to release three Israeli hostages as Gaza ceasefire holds

articles.author: Emma Farge, Maggie Fick, Poppy Mcpherson, Humeyra Pamuk, Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: The spiraling consequences underline the real-world harms from Donald Trump's upending of decades-old U.S. initiatives.
articles.title: Trump’s aid freeze sparks mayhem around the world

articles.author: David Latona
articles.description: The speakers railed against immigration and most called for a new "Reconquista", a reference to the medieval conquest of Muslim-controlled parts of the Iberian Peninsula by Christians.
articles.title: Orban, Le Pen hail Trump at far-right 'Patriots' summit in Madrid
Leaders from Eastern and Southern African blocs seek solutions to Congo conflict
Indian PM Modi's party set to win election in capital after 27 years out of power

articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Steve Holland
articles.description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order to cut U.S. financial assistance to South Africa, the White House said on Friday, citing disapproval of its land policy and of its genocide case at the International Court of Justice against Washington's ally Israel.
articles.title: Trump signs order to cut funding for South Africa over land policy, ICJ case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon formed a new government on Saturday, following unusually direct U.S. intervention in the process and in a step intended to bring the country closer to accessing reconstruction funds following a devastating war between Israel and Hezbollah.
articles.title: Lebanon PM forms new government, pledging reforms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan has sent officials to Washington to discuss possible U.S. tariffs by President Donald Trump, and has made preparations should they be imposed, Economy Minister Kuo Jyh-huei said on Saturday.
articles.title: Taiwan sends officials to US to discuss possible Trump tariffs

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration announced on Friday that it had approved military sales to Israel worth some $7.4 billion, despite a Democratic lawmakers' request that the sale be paused until he received more information.
articles.title: Trump administration backs big arms sales to Israel, defying Congress

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei met with acting Hamas leader Khalil al-Hayya and two other leaders of the Palestinian group in Tehran on Saturday, Iranian state media reported.
articles.title: Iran leader Khamenei meets top Hamas leaders in Tehran, state media says
